Text: Policy violence is when the richest country in the world does not guarantee housing, childcare, or healthcare for its people. We can and must do better.

In our journey towards justice & our collective liberation, we must continue to pursue race-conscious policies that address the economic injustices that communities of color have been enduring for decades. 
 
We can start by addressing the racial wealth gap head-on.

Housing is a critical determinant of health & economic opportunity.

That's why I'm still fighting to pass the #BuildBackBetter Act, which includes my bill to help first-generation homebuyers purchase a home & begin building wealth.
https://t.co/C1S900xXzd

These economic disparities are a direct result of policies that have locked Black & brown communities out of building wealth.

The #MA7 is one of the most diverse yet unequal districts in the country, where white folks have a median net worth of $247,500 & Black folks have a median net worth of just $8.
 
One way to help address this disparity is for @POTUS to #CancelStudentDebt.
https://t.co/rsRtIrHsGF

Racial justice is economic justice.

Addressing the racial wealth gap demands policies that affirm economic justice for our Black communities.

This #BlackHistoryMonth, let's remain unapologetic in our Work to close the racial wealth gap. Here's how I‚Äôm working to get this done.

How will the BBB Act help lower healthcare costs?

‚úÖInvests $1 billion to fund renovation, construction, and expansion of community health centers providing critical care to our most vulnerable

How will the BBB Act help lower healthcare costs?

‚úÖSupports seniors by expanding Medicare to cover hearing services like hearing aids which can range from $500-$600 dollars
‚úÖCaps the cost of insulin at $35 per month

How will the BBB Act help lower healthcare costs?

‚úÖAllows Medicare to negotiate prices directly with drug companies to ensure prices are fair.
‚úÖSets a $2,000 cap on out-of-pocket costs on prescription drugs for Seniors on Medicare Part D.

How will the BBB Act combat the climate crisis?

‚úÖInvests in environmental justice communities and building urban parks
‚úÖMakes renewable energy cheaper and electrifies buildings, vehicles, and housing

How will the BBB Act combat the climate crisis?

‚úÖThe boldest effort to combat climate change in American history with $555+ billion in investments in clean energy & other climate solutions
‚úÖEstablishes new Civilian Climate Corps that will create 300,000 good-paying, green jobs

How will the BBB Act invest in our care economy?
 
‚úÖInvests $150 billion to expand access to home & community based services & will help ensure healthcare workers are able to earn livable wages

How will the BBB Act invest in our care economy?
 
‚úÖThe US is the only industrialized nation with no national paid family & medical leave. The BBB Act would change that by providing 4 weeks of paid, family caregiving medical leave.

How will the BBB Act invest in our care economy?

‚úÖIncludes the largest investment in childcare in history & will help drastically lower the costs of childcare
‚úÖMost families will pay no more than 7% of their income on childcare costs &childcare workers will earn a livable wage

How will the BBB Act invest in our care economy?
 
‚úÖInvests $400 billion to provide universal pre-k to 3 & 4 year-olds & tackle the childcare affordability crisis
‚úÖThese investments will help expand pre-k to more than 136,000 across MA.
